page.title: Capture Goals
page.html:
Goals

In any business IT project or service, arguably the most important attribute to ensure sustained investment is to consistently achieve the goals set by the business stakeholders. At each phase or step along the way, the goals are often best described by documenting a set of key performance indicators (KPIs).

The KPIs need not necessarily be financially based, although often they are, so long as all participants agree they are achievable and meaningful in the context of the current project objectives. Once you have a clear set of KPIs for the project it makes setting priorities on product roadmap requirements a lot easier.
